value.title: How to Make a Tensorflow Image Classifier (LIVE)
value.excerpt: We're going to build an image classifier using just Tensorflow (no Keras). This will be in depth, the goal for this video is for you to fully understand how a Convolutional Neural Network works. We'll visualize the filters we create along the way as well.  Code for this video: https://github.com/llSourcell/How_to_make_a_tensorflow_image_classifier_LIVE/blob/master/demonotes.ipynb
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/APmF6qE3Vjc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to Use Tensorflow for Classification (LIVE)
value.excerpt: In this live session I'll introduce & give an overview of Google's Deep Learning library, Tensorflow. Then we'll use it to build a neural network capable of predicting housing prices, with me explaining every step along the way.  Code for this video: https://github.com/llSourcell/How_to_use_Tensorflow_for_classification-LIVE
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4urPuRoT1sE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to Use Tensorflow for Seq2seq Models (LIVE)
value.excerpt: Let's build a Sequence to Sequence model in Tensorflow to learn exactly how they work. You can use this model to make chatbots, language translators, text generators, and much more . We'll go over memory, attention, and some variants (like bidirectional layers) both programmatically and mathematically.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ElmBrKyMXxs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to Use Tensorflow for Time Series (Live)
value.excerpt: We're going to use Tensorflow to predict the next event in a time series dataset. This can be applied to any kind of sequential data.   Code for this video: https://github.com/llSourcell/rnn_tutorial  Please Subscribe! And Like. And comment. That's what keeps me going.   More learning resources: https://github.com/tgjeon/TensorFlow-Tutorials-for-Time-Series
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hhJIztWR_vo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: All About TensorFlow Code (Coding TensorFlow)
value.excerpt: Welcome to our new series: Coding TensorFlow!   This series is dedicated to deep-dive TensorFlow tutorials -  Every episode will provide concrete, hands-on examples of how to best use TensorFlow for machine learning and AI. We hope you find them helpful!  Subscribe to the channel to catch new episodes

value.title: Build a neural network to perform classification | TensorFlow.js (Coding TensorFlow)
value.excerpt: In part 3 of this series on TensorFlow.js, Laurence Moroney (@lmoroney) looks at taking the processed data from part 2, and building a neural network to perform classification with it. You’ll see how to create and stack multiple layers, use these to create a classifier, and then test that classifier

value.title: How do TFX pipelines work? (TensorFlow Extended)
value.excerpt: On today’s episode of TensorFlow Extended hosted by TensorFlow Developer Advocate, Robert Crowe, we’re asking the question, “How do TFX pipelines work?” Learn more on Episode 2 of the 5 part series on Real World Machine Learning in Production. value.title: Neural Structured Learning - Part 1: Framework overview
value.excerpt: In this video series, we’re going to introduce a new learning framework to our developers called Neural Structured Learning. TensorFlow Senior Software Engineer Da-Cheng Juan kicks off this series with the framework overview.  Links: Get started with Neural Structured Learning → https://goo.gle/2sOz6DE

value.title: Neural Structured Learning - Part 2: Training with natural graphs
value.excerpt: Welcome to episode 2 of our short series on Neural Structured Learning! In this episode, Software Engineer Arjun Gopalan discusses what natural graphs are and how they can be used to train neural networks.   Graphs are powerful data structures and can be used to represent data that most of us interact

value.title: Neural Structured Learning - Part 3: Training with synthesized graphs
value.excerpt: Welcome to episode 3 of our short series on Neural Structured Learning! In this episode, Software Engineer Arjun Gopalan discusses how graphs can be constructed from raw input data and then be used to train neural networks. value.title: Neural Structured Learning - Part 4: Adversarial learning for image classification
value.excerpt: Welcome to the 4th episode of this Neural Structured Learning series. In this video, we are going to talk about learning with implicit structured signals constructed from adversarial learning. value.title: TensorFlow Lite for iOS (Coding TensorFlow)
value.excerpt: In this episode of Coding TensorFlow, Laurence Moroney, Developer Advocate for TensorFlow at Google, talks us through how TensorFlow Lite works on iOS. You'll see how to deploy a trained model to an iOS App, and how you can run inference with it, using C++ called from a Swift App.  Building TensorFlow
